summary: This is an email chain between US Attorney's Office personnel regarding the filing of Ghislaine Maxwell's motions in limine in her criminal case. It includes the forwarding of a defense attorney's email that formally submitted the motions to the court.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell, for whom her defense team has filed motions in limine.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Sent the email from the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., attaching Ms. Maxwell's motions in limine to Judge Nathan's chambers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who requested the motions be sent to the court.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the external email submitting the motions.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to whom the motions are addressed.

connections.description: Jeffrey Pagliuca is a defense attorney acting on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell, as he requested the filing of her motions in limine.
Laura Menninger is a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the formal submission of motions to the court.
Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, working together on her case.
Nicole Simmons, from the law firm, is sending documents at the request of defense attorney Jeffrey Pagliuca.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's Motions in Limine
events.description: The defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell files 13 motions in limine in her criminal case.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed 13 motions in limine in her criminal case (U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The motions were formally submitted to Judge Nathan's chambers via email from Nicole Simmons of the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.
The submission was made at the request of defense attorney Jeffrey Pagliuca, with attorney Laura Menninger copied on the correspondence.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding access to these defense filings.
